page.title: 16The Commoners
page.content: This area contains a large part of{ {Quantock Common}with its 62{ {registrations }of ancient common rights and customs.These rights are 1 {ESTOVERS }the taking of tree lopping, gorse or underwood. 2 {TURBARY}the cutting of turf or peat 3 {HERBAGE or PASTORAGE }the right to graze a set number of cattle, sheep, ponies, goats or pigs. 4 {PANNAGE}the turning out of pigs to eat acorns and beechmast. 5 {FIREBOTE and HEDGEBOTE }taking timber for burning and fencing. 6 {PISCARY }the taking of fish. 7 {BRACKEN-CUTTING. } The Commoners Association is concerned in safe-guarding these rights whilst bearing in mind the other users of the hill and the pressures exerted by them all.
